main event: A sighting of a shining object approximately 3 feet long that fell to the ground in Las Lunas, New Mexico on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed using ground radar and visual air observations., The nature of the object was undetermined with several possibilities considered including a balloon, moon, or satellite., There was limited data available from the observer, and there was apparently no effort to recover the object., The sighting was recorded as related to two separate sightings in a preliminary UFO report., Weather conditions and a 2-degree inversion were noted at the time of the observation.
witness description: Details about the witness are unknown.
